A **giant bat**, B, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is slightly stronger than a standard [bat](/wiki/Bat "Bat"), and like other [bats and birds](/wiki/Bat_or_bird "Bat or bird") it is capable of [flight](/wiki/Flight "Flight"). Giant bats will flit erratically about the dungeon: there is a 1⁄3 chance of the monster moving in a random direction during each of its turns.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

A giant bat has a single bite attack.

Eating a giant bat [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") will [stun](/wiki/Stun "Stun") you for up to 30 (more) turns.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) A character [polymorphed](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") into a giant bat is intrinsically stunned for the duration of the polyself.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.3 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Randomly generated giant bats are always generated hostile. A bat can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into a giant bat.

Giant bats appear among the random B that are part of the first quest [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") for [Wizards](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Wizard quest](/wiki/Wizard_quest "Wizard quest").

Giant bats generated in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom") have slightly higher speed than normal, possibly a play on the phrase "like a bat \[on its way] out of hell".[\[4\]](#cite_note-batoutofhell-4)

## Strategy

The giant bat has the same high [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed") as a regular bat with a slightly stronger bite, making it more dangerous for starting characters to deal with - an inopportune run-in with a giant bat can be lethal for characters that are especially weak or else lack a weapon with reliable accuracy.

## History

The giant bat first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), giant bats appear among the random B that are part of the first quest [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") for [Necromancers](/wiki/Necromancer "Necromancer") and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Necromancer quest](/wiki/Necromancer_quest "Necromancer quest").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), giant bats can grow up into [battle-bats](/wiki/Battle-bat "Battle-bat").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), two giant bats are generated within Gollum's Cave in [Goblin Town](/wiki/Goblin_Town "Goblin Town") at level creation.

## Encyclopedia entry

A bat, flitting in the darkness outside, took the wrong turn  
as it made its nightly rounds and came in through the window  
which had been left healthfully open. It then proceeded to  
circle the room in the aimless fat-headed fashion habitual  
with bats, who are notoriously among the less intellectually  
gifted of God's creatures. Show me a bat, says the old  
proverb, and I will show you something that ought to be in  
some kind of a home.  
\[ A Pelican at Blandings, by P. G. Wodehouse ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/monmove.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 915](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/monmove.c#L915)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/eat.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1013](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/eat.c#L1013)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [include/youprop.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 79](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/include/youprop.h#L79)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-batoutofhell_4-0) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1275](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L1275)

Giant bat

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
B giant bat
Difficulty 3
Attacks Bite 1d6
B giant bat
Difficulty 3
Attacks

Bite 1d6

Base level 2
Base experience 22
Speed 22
Base AC 7
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 2 (Quite rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 30
Nutritional value 30
Size Small
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A giant bat:

  • can fly.
  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • wanders randomly.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference monst.c#line1127

A giant bat, B, is a type of monster that appears in NetHack. It is slightly stronger than a standard bat, and like other bats and birds it is capable of flight. Giant bats will flit erratically about the dungeon: there is a 1⁄3 chance of the monster moving in a random direction during each of its turns.[1]

A giant bat has a single bite attack.

Eating a giant bat corpse or tin will stun you for up to 30 (more) turns.[2] A character polymorphed into a giant bat is intrinsically stunned for the duration of the polyself.[3]

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 SLASH'EM
    • 4.2 dNetHack

Generation

Randomly generated giant bats are always generated hostile. A bat can grow up into a giant bat.

Giant bats appear among the random B that are part of the first quest monster class for Wizards and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Wizard quest.

Giant bats generated in Gehennom have slightly higher speed than normal, possibly a play on the phrase "like a bat [on its way] out of hell".[4]

Strategy

The giant bat has the same high speed as a regular bat with a slightly stronger bite, making it more dangerous for starting characters to deal with - an inopportune run-in with a giant bat can be lethal for characters that are especially weak or else lack a weapon with reliable accuracy.

History

The giant bat first appears in NetHack 3.0.0.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, giant bats appear among the random B that are part of the first quest monster class for Necromancers and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Necromancer quest.

dNetHack

In dNetHack and notdNetHack, giant bats can grow up into battle-bats.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, two giant bats are generated within Gollum's Cave in Goblin Town at level creation.

Encyclopedia entry

A bat, flitting in the darkness outside, took the wrong turn
as it made its nightly rounds and came in through the window
which had been left healthfully open. It then proceeded to
circle the room in the aimless fat-headed fashion habitual
with bats, who are notoriously among the less intellectually
gifted of God's creatures. Show me a bat, says the old
proverb, and I will show you something that ought to be in
some kind of a home.
[ A Pelican at Blandings, by P. G. Wodehouse ]

References

A '''giant bat''', {{monsym|giant bat}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is slightly stronger than a standard [[bat]], and like other [[bat or bird|bats and birds]] it is capable of [[flight]]. Giant bats will flit erratically about the dungeon: there is a {{frac|3}} chance of the monster moving in a random direction during each of its turns.{{refsrc|src/monmove.c|915|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

A giant bat has a single bite attack.

Eating a giant bat [[corpse]] or [[tin]] will [[stun]] you for up to 30 (more) turns.{{refsrc|src/eat.c|1013|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} A character [[polymorph]]ed into a giant bat is intrinsically stunned for the duration of the polyself.{{refsrc|include/youprop.h|79|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

==Generation==
Randomly generated giant bats are always generated hostile. A bat can [[grow up]] into a giant bat.

Giant bats appear among the random {{white|B}} that are part of the first quest [[monster class]] for [[Wizard]]s and make up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Wizard quest]].

Giant bats generated in [[Gehennom]] have slightly higher speed than normal, possibly a play on the phrase "like a bat [on its way] out of hell".{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|1275|version=NetHack 3.6.7|name=batoutofhell}}

==Strategy==
The giant bat has the same high [[speed]] as a regular bat with a slightly stronger bite, making it more dangerous for starting characters to deal with - an inopportune run-in with a giant bat can be lethal for characters that are especially weak or else lack a weapon with reliable accuracy.

==History==
The giant bat first appears in [[NetHack 3.0.0]].

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], giant bats appear among the random {{white|B}} that are part of the first quest [[monster class]] for [[Necromancer]]s and make up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Necromancer quest]].

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]], giant bats can grow up into [[battle-bat]]s.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], two giant bats are generated within Gollum's Cave in [[Goblin Town]] at level creation.

==Encyclopedia entry==
{{encyclopedia|A bat, flitting in the darkness outside, took the wrong turn
as it made its nightly rounds and came in through the window
which had been left healthfully open.  It then proceeded to
circle the room in the aimless fat-headed fashion habitual
with bats, who are notoriously among the less intellectually
gifted of God's creatures.  Show me a bat, says the old
proverb, and I will show you something that ought to be in
some kind of a home.
[ A Pelican at Blandings, by P. G. Wodehouse ]
}}
